presume.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to think that something is true, although you are not certain
presume.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Each of you will make a speech, I presume?
‘Are his parents still alive?’ 'I presume so.’
I presume we’ll be there by six o'clock.
From the way he talked, I presumed him to be your boss.
The temple is presumed to date from the first century BC.
presume.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to accept something as true until it is shown to not be true, especially in law
presume.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: We must presume innocence until we have evidence of guilt.
Their nephew was missing, presumed dead.
presume.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to behave without respect or politeness by doing something that you have no right to do
presume.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I would never presume to tell you what to do.
presume.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to accept something as being true and base something else on it
presume.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: The Ancient History course presumes some knowledge of Greek.
I presume that someone will be there to meet us when we arrive.
